Row.Text: Longship
Ancient Era Naval Unit that is faster than the Trireme it replaces and also transfers its movement to any embarked units it escorts. Only Denmark may build it.

Only Denmark may build this unit. It is a faster version of the Trireme. Like the Trireme it is a melee attack unit, engaging units at sea or cities (but it has no ranged attack). It also transfers its movement speed to any embarked units it escorts, so Denmark can use this tactic to speed up embarked units for exploration or coastal raiding. The Longship cannot enter Deep Ocean tiles outside of the city borders.

[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Source: Wikipedia (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Longship)[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Longships were a type of ship invented and used by the Norsemen for trade, commerce, exploration, and warfare during the Viking Age. The longship's design evolved over many centuries, beginning in the Stone Age with the invention of the umiak and continuing up until the 6th century with clinker built ships like Nydam and Kvalsund. The longship appeared in its complete form between the 9th and 13th centuries. The character and appearance of these ships have been reflected in Scandinavian boat-building traditions until today. The particular skills and methods employed in making longships are still used worldwide, often with modern adaptations. They were all made out of wood, with cloth sails (woven wool) and had numerous details and carvings on the hull.
[COLOR_WARNING_TEXT](DE_DE text) [ENDCOLOR]Longship

Transfer Movement to Embarked Units
Embarked units move at rate of this unit if they start the turn escorted.
